intro: Scilla viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered scilla, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, greenish-blue flowers in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, making it an important species in local ecosystems. Scilla viridiflora is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
